question:
If a didentate ligand ethane -1,2-diamine is progressively added in the molar ratio en: Ni::1:1, 2:1, 3:1 to <katex>$[Ni(H_{2}O)_{6}]^{2+}$</katex> aq solution, following co-ordination entities are formed.
I. <katex>$[Ni(H_{2}O)_{4}en]^{2+}$</katex> -pale blue
II. <katex>$[Ni(H_{2}O)_{2}(en)_{2}]^{2+}$</katex> -blue/purple
III. <katex>$[Ni(en)_{3}]^{2+}$</katex> -violet
The wavelength in nm of light absorbed in case of I and III are respectively
explanation: The ligand field strength of 'en' is greater than 'H2O'.
As more 'en' ligands are added (I -> II -> III), the crystal field splitting (<katex>$\Delta_o$</katex>) increases.
Comparing options, only B fits: 600 nm > 535 nm.
